result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Thomas Nielsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Thomas Nielsen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph Thomas Nielsen was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 20, 2015.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CM81.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CM81.

-Participate in any recommended treatment and/or programming recommended by Agent.
-Defendant to maintain employment or education.
-Stay clear of mood altering drugs.
-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Pay Supervision fees.

From DE stating he will be in tomrw to make his pymt.  Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

DE called to state that he may not make it in by 4:30 pm to make his pymt today.  DE was advised that he has until 5 pm today to make his pymt & that if he absolutely cannot get here, I will approve the pymt to be pd by 5 pm tomrw.   DE stated that he has a schedule to work around & was reminded that the court has been more than flexible w/his pymts & he needs to attempt to make his pymts by his scheduled due date of the 15th.   Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf
From DE stating he will make his pymt tomrw.  Ret'd call to DE & left a v/m stating he is approved to make his pymt by 4:30 pm on 9-21-18.  Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

DE came back to pay the remainder of the monthly pymt & was advised that he may write a letter to request to have his pymts lowered if he is having ongoing issues making the pymts.  DE was advised he may ask for a piece of paper & write it at the counter after he makes his pymt.  DE stated he would probably do so, but only made his pymt & left.  Pymts in full are due as scheduled.  Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

DE appeared at counter right before 3 pm requesting to make a partial pymt.  DE was advised that pymts are to be pd in full ea mo.  DE stated he could get the add'l $20 & be back by 4:30 pm.  DE was advised that he may have until 8 am tomrw to make his pymt.  Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 8-30-2018. cah

DE called stating he will make his pymt tomrw.  DE is approved to make his pymt by 4:30 pm tomrw.  Clerk inquired if DE had a phone # to reference for return calls & DE stated he does not at this time.  DE was advised to be sure to call the Pymt Clerk Desk & not the Family Desk or any other desk to ensure his messages are being rec'd.  Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

From DE (left w/the Family Desk) requesting to make pymt on the 22nd or 23rd.  DE did not leave a phone # to call him back.  Pymt due as scheduled - clerk has gone over the Pymt Plan details w/the DE several times.  Includes 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 7-26-18. cah

From DE on 7-17-18 @ 4:52 pm requesting an ext until the 21st, 22nd, or 23rd.  Ret'd call to DE @ the phone # he requested a call back on today x 3, but was unable to leave a v/m as the # is "temporarily out of service".  Clerk attempted to call the phone # the DE called from, but was unsure who's v/m it belonged to & did not leave a v/m.  Includes 15TR1417, 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf
From DE requesting to make his pymt on 6-20-18.  Ret'd call to DE & approved his pymt to be made by 4:30 pm on 6-20-18.  Includes 15TR1417, 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

From DE on 5-18-18 @ 3:40 pm stating he was supposed to make his pymt by 4:30 pm, but doesn't get pd until Wed.  Ret'd call to DE today & left a v/m stating I will approve his pymt to be pd by 4:30 pm on 5-23-18, but reminded him again that pymts are due by the 15th of ea mo, grace periods are not the same ea mo, & he is to make arrangements to make his pymts on or before his scheduled due date of the 15th going fwd.  Includes 15TR1417, 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

From DE requesting an ext until Fri.  Ret'd call to DE @ the # he requested a return call to (Note:  DE has called from several different #s in the last couple days) & spoke to his live in gf.  DE's gf was advised that his pymt is approved to be pd by 4:30 pm on 5-18-18.  DE's gf stated she would let him know when she picks him up for work today.  Includes 15TR1417, 15CM81, 18CF42.  jaf

DE was advised that I only caught the error because he advised me he was making a $100 pymt & his closed case Pmt Plan is only scheduled for $50/mo.  DE MUST provide case #s for both Pymt Plans in the future to avoid a WA being issued.  Receipt was voided & re-receipted to both Pymt Plans. CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski for today,  DF:  Joseph Thomas Nielsen appeared from jail. c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif

c: Def & Atty. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF: Joseph Thomas Nielsen appeared. Case called at 8:07. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. Caton agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 removing the domestic abuse inhancer in 15CM81. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 removing the domestic abuse inhancer in 15CM81. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM81. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H.
1 year probation with conditions:
- Costs including costs of supervision.
- Participate in any recommended treatment and programming recommended by agent. 
- DE to maintain employment or education. 
- Stay clear of any mood altering drugs. Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

DE is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.
DE to report to probation today.
Filed by ADA Nieskes. Requesting a continuance of 10/2015 JT. km
Plea hearing at 10-20-2015 08:00 am

Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Final pre-trial at 10-05-2015 02:30 pm.
Jury trial at 10-20-2015 08:00 am.

  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

per Defendant in court. eif

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Morgan M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Defendant to be escorted by St. Croix County Sheriff to get his belongings.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Joseph Thomas Nielsen appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
